pr_title: CUSTCOM-24 Restore Persistent EJB Timers on Payara Micro Restart

timeline.message:
CUSTCOM-24 Prevent NPE in JobCleanUpService

When starting Payara Micro, the cleanup service will return a NPE due to
the executor also being null. This change allows the service to disable
itself, and doing so will cause each method to be disabled.

This was a bug introduced in 5033d8edb3bb22d797cd8ddf0aa4b47380e1a227.

Signed-off-by: Matt Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>

CUSTCOM-24 Prevent NPE in JobCleanUpService

When starting Payara Micro, the cleanup service will return a NPE due to
the executor also being null. This change allows the service to disable
itself, and doing so will cause each method to be disabled.

This was a bug introduced in 5033d8edb3bb22d797cd8ddf0aa4b47380e1a227.

Signed-off-by: Matt Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>

CUSTCOM-24 Save application unique ID on app load

EJB timers firing rely on the container ID being consistent, which is
determined in turn by the application unique ID. This change saves the
unique ID of the first deployment to the clustered store, so be used on
future redeployments.

This functionality was removed in Payara 5 with
3cd40212ec11cbbe9a3740100a3ef3a5449364a9.

Signed-off-by: Matt Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>

CUSTCOM-24 Reenable Micro clustered store access

The Payara Micro main thread didn't have access to the clustered store,
but this was required to save the application unique ID to the store on
initialisation.

Signed-off-by: Matt Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>

timeline.message:
CUSTCOM-24 Enable hazelcast before application load

Fixes have been made to Hazelcast that mean that it can be initialised
earlier in the startup lifecycle. This should simplify the startup
process which should, in turn, provide protection against future race
conditions or complications caused by the complexity of Hazelcast
initialisation.

Signed-off-by: Matt Gill <matthew.gill@live.co.uk>
